columns.name: maprojid
columns.description: Unique identifier that defines a discrete project. The maprojid is a concatenation of magency and projectid and it is the primary key.

columns.name: magency
columns.description: Three digit code of the distinct City agency managing the project.

columns.name: projectid
columns.description: Alphanumeric code created by the sponsor agency that identifies a distinct project. A Project ID must be unique within a managing agency.

columns.name: description
columns.description: Short description of the project as described by the sponsor agency. If one projectid had many descriptions the longest description is reported by CPDB.

columns.name: ccnonexempt
columns.description: Sum of City Cost (Non-Exempt) funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: ccexempt
columns.description: Sum of City Cost (Exempt) funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: totalcityplannedcommit
columns.description: Sum of City funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: nccstate
columns.description: Sum of State funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: nccfederal
columns.description: Sum of Federal funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: nccother
columns.description: Sum of Other funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: totalnoncityplannedcommit
columns.description: Sum of Non-City funding across all commitments associated with the project.

columns.name: totalplannedcommit
columns.description: Sum of City Cost and Non-City Cost, which reports the total planned commitments for the project allocated in the Capital Commitment Plan.

columns.name: totalspend
columns.description: Sum of check values from Checkbook NYC associated with the project.

columns.name: maxdate
columns.description: The latest panned commitment date associated with the project.

columns.name: mindate
columns.description: The earliest panned commitment date associated with the project.

columns.name: magencyacro
columns.description: Common acronym of the city agency managing the project. This value is derived from the three digit managing agency code.

columns.name: magencyname
columns.description: Common name for the city agency mananging the project. This value is derived from the three digit managing agency code.

columns.name: typecategory
columns.description: Classification given by DCP based on keywords found in the short description describing if a projects is Fixed Asset, Lump Sum, or ITT, Vehicles, and Equipment.

columns.name: ccpversion
columns.description: Reports the version of the Capital Commitment Plan which the record is based on.

columns.name: geometry
columns.description: Spatial data for the project.

fields.name: Agency

existing_fields.Update Frequency Details: Office of Management and Budget (OMB) publishes Capital Commitment Plan three times a year as a series of pdf files, generally in the months of January, April, and September as part of the publication of the Preliminary, Executive, and Adopted Capital Budgets.

view.description:
Spatial data at the point level can be joined to the tabular Capital Projects dataset using the FSM ID. A majority of the spatial data was made available on NYC Open Data by agency partners. Some geometries were created manually, while others relied on 'Fuzzy String Matching'. This process relied on a join to DCP's Facilities Database and DPR's Parks Properties to match project descriptions to physical locations.

To explore the data, please visit Capital Planning Explorer
For additional information, please visit A Guide to The Capital Budget

relatedViews.name: Capital Projects Database (CPDB) - Projects (Points Map)
relatedViews.description: Spatial data at the point level can be joined to the tabular Capital Projects dataset using the FSM ID. A majority of the spatial data was made available on NYC Open Data by agency partners. Some geometries were created manually, while others relied on 'Fuzzy String Matching'. This process relied on a join to DCP's Facilities Database and DPR's Parks Properties to match project descriptions to physical locations. To explore the data, please visit Capital Planning Explorer For additional information, please visit A Guide to The Capital Budget
